required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Speech Intelligibility in Quiet and Noise for New vs. Legacy Hearing Aids
clinical_study.official_title: Speech Intelligibility in Quiet and Noise for New Versus Legacy Hearing Aids

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical investigation is designed to compare audiological performance (i.e., measurements of sound quality and speech understanding) between Starkey's new receiver-in-canal device and a commercially available legacy receiver-in-canal device.

detailed_description.textblock: Starkey is investigating a new hearing aid with several new audiological features. These features have been assessed for benefit, individually, but this clinical investigation will serve as a test for safety and efficacy with all hearing aid features, together. The design of this study is a single-blinded, crossover design and will be conducted at Starkey's headquarters in Eden Prairie, MN.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Crossover Assignment - Each participant will experience both test conditions (counterbalanced)

primary_outcome.measure: Speech intelligibility (% words repeated back correctly) in quiet and noise for new vs. legacy hearing aids
primary_outcome.description: IEEE sentences will be presented to the research participants in quiet and in background noise. The percent words repeated back correctly will be scored and serve as the reported result of this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: First fit ratings of sound quality on subjective questionnaires for the new vs. legacy hearing aids
secondary_outcome.description: This data will be collected through lab testing following the first fit of the hearing aids. Participants will answer questionnaire items related to their impressions of sound quality. Results will be collected using a 7-point Likert scale, and ratings (1-7) will be analyzed using descriptive statistics. Statistical measures for repeated measurements will be used to understand any differences between hearing aid conditions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of the new, receiver-in-canal devices through tracking of adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: This data will be collected through the tracking of adverse events.

arm_group.description: New Receiver-in-Canal device, successor of previous device generation
Legacy Receiver-in-Canal device that is currently available on the market

intervention.description: Receiver-in-canal device available on the market

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults, minimum age of 18
- Native English speakers
- Ability to complete questionnaires and laboratory assessments
- Symmetric, mild to moderately-severe sensorineural hearing loss
- Informed consent completed with signature
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to visit the Starkey Headquarters building for testing
- Central or middle ear hearing problems
- Medical contraindications to wearing hearing aids
- Learning disability, major cognitive handicap, or serious neurological or psychiatric disease that would prevent or restrict participation, as determined by the PI or designee
